flashcards.english: ũyũ nĩ mũciĩ mũnene wa Nairobi (this is the city of Nairobi), Taũni nene ya Nairobi (the big town of Nairobi), Gaũdencia e ol-jororok (Gaudencia is in Ol-jororok), We wĩkũ? (Where are you?)
flashcards.notes: Common location expressions. Shows use of 'mũciĩ mũnene' (big city/town), 'e' (is in/at), 'wĩkũ' (where)

flashcards.english: Kwanyu kũhana atĩa? (How is your place?), Kwĩna heho kana mbura? (Is it cold or rainy?), Kana kwĩna riũwa? (Or is it sunny?), Gwitũ kũrĩ na rũhuho (Our place is windy)
flashcards.notes: Weather conversation pattern. Two ways to say 'there is': Kwĩna or Kũrĩ na. Heho (cold), mbura (rain), riũwa (sun), rũhuho (wind)

flashcards.english: Nĩ thaa cĩgana (What time is it?), Nĩ thaa ĩmwe (7 o'clock), Nĩ thaa ĩmwe na ndagĩka ĩmwe (7:01), Nĩ thaa igĩrĩ na nuthu (8:30), Nĩ thaa ĩthatũ itigarĩtie ndagĩka ikũmi na ithano (9:45 - remaining 15 min), Nĩ thaa thita (midday), Nĩ thinacara (6pm)
flashcards.notes: Complete time-telling system. Time periods: Rũciĩ-nĩ (morning), Mĩaraho (around midday), Hwaĩ-nĩ (evening), Ũtũkũ (night). Itigarĩtie (remaining with/short of). Irũgamĩte (sharp/exactly)
